intro: Hieracium dimorphotrichum, commonly known as the two-tailed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are usually lobed or toothed. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, often with a distinctive two-lobed structure at the base of the flower head. Hieracium dimorphotrichum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed sites, thriving in temperate climates.
